about.intro:
Born and raised in Osaka, currently living in Tokyo.
Majored in Information Science at the Faculty of Science and Engineering, and belonged to a Natural Language Processing lab. Experienced in a wide range of development, mainly web applications, including back-end, front-end, and batch processing. Interested in NLP since my student days, and currently developing a language learning app that utilizes YouTube subtitles and generative AI.

ytgenai.catch: Multilingual Learning Support Web App Using YouTube Subtitles and Generative AI
ytgenai.desc: Focusing on the compatibility of Japanese and Korean subtitles and the similarities in grammar and vocabulary, we are developing a language learning website where fans can share and accumulate learning data and commentary through otaku content.

stack.name: Back-End: Python, Django
stack.reason: I used Python to develop a YouTube subtitle analysis tool during university, and since most YouTube-related information is available in Python, I chose to use it for this project.

stack.name: Front-End: TypeScript, Vue.js
stack.reason: I chose Vue.js to learn it through personal development, as I had no experience with it at work.

languagesList.name: Java
languagesList.detail: Extensive experience in back-end and batch processing, mainly using Spring Boot. Mainly used in professional work.

languagesList.name: TypeScript
languagesList.detail: Developed admin dashboards using Vue.js at work. Also used in personal projects.

languagesList.name: Python
languagesList.detail: Used widely for personal development and scripting.

languagesList.name: Rust
languagesList.detail: Used in back-end development at work. Currently still learning.

databasesList.name: PostgreSQL
databasesList.detail: Used in both professional and personal development. Proficient in basic SQL operations.

infraList.name: AWS
infraList.detail: Experience with basic services. Currently learning more advanced usage.

languageskillList.name: Korean
languageskillList.summary: Able to engage in simple conversations and self-introductions. Continuously self-studying.
languageskillList.detail: Learned Korean as a second foreign language in university. Later rekindled interest due to the virtual idol group '이세계아이돌'. Attracted by the similarities between Korean and Japanese grammar and vocabulary, and the ease of learning through subtitles. Studying through YouTube, VRChat, and Maum. Can handle light conversations and introductions. Familiar with Hangul reading and pronunciation, though vocabulary is limited and skewed toward otaku terms.

languageskillList.name: Chinese
languageskillList.summary: Can understand basic daily expressions. Currently learning pronunciation and conversation.
languageskillList.detail: Studying for a few months. Can read some pinyin, but still struggling with accurate pronunciation. Practicing through Hello Talk with Chinese friends who speak Japanese. Understanding simple phrases like 'go to work' or 'eat a meal' is improving. Reading is getting better, but speaking, listening, and writing remain areas to improve. Learning vocabulary around HSK Level 4 and trying to output through conversation.

languageskillList.name: English
languageskillList.summary: Mainly getting used to English environments through listening.
languageskillList.detail: Started learning English in junior high school but didn't study seriously at the time. Currently exposed to English mainly through listening, inspired by English VTubers such as NIJISANJI EN. Although not studying systematically, aiming to improve understanding gradually through content I enjoy.
